name: places/ChIJk5I-rVdYwokREJuq-CY6pEg
formattedAddress: 253 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA
adrFormatAddress: 253 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bakery & coffeehouse serving upscale coffees, teas & a selection of housemade baked goods & syrups.

originalText.text: Amazing bakery with lot of Asian options. We ordered tarts. We ordered black bean cake and then we ordered some coffee and everything tasted really good. Definitely come here if you are in the area.

text.text: Amazing bakery with lot of Asian options. We ordered tarts. We ordered black bean cake and then we ordered some coffee and everything tasted really good. Definitely come here if you are in the area.

originalText.text: The pastries are cute, creative, and delicious with a variety of options available. The cream puffs are must tries, they are amazingly delicate and delicious. The prices are a bit high, but the unique offerings make it worth the price.

text.text: The pastries are cute, creative, and delicious with a variety of options available. The cream puffs are must tries, they are amazingly delicate and delicious. The prices are a bit high, but the unique offerings make it worth the price.

originalText.text: They have savory side dishes… Good coffee… It’s the customer service that a little slow… I waited for my small latte more than five minutes. I already ate my pastry… I think they should cut down our talking behind the register. Focus on getting the job done… Otherwise, it’s a nice place… The food is good and they have competitive pricing. I love my egg dish… It was fresh… Flaky… Flavorful…

text.text: They have savory side dishes… Good coffee… It’s the customer service that a little slow… I waited for my small latte more than five minutes. I already ate my pastry… I think they should cut down our talking behind the register. Focus on getting the job done… Otherwise, it’s a nice place… The food is good and they have competitive pricing. I love my egg dish… It was fresh… Flaky… Flavorful…

originalText.text:
This shop was amazing. I had the hazelnut, chocolate puff pastry and the sesame walnut puff pastry and it was airy, delicious, and refreshing. I also got the bourbon brûlée iced latte and it was the perfect fall tasting drink.

As for the service, I would like to thank the wonderful employee that has short hair. I cannot have gelatin as I am Muslim and she kindly informed me that all the cute cakes have gelatin. This gesture was really sweet to me and because of it I will be recommending this spot to all my friends that come visit. The hospitality really made a difference. This on top of the great drinks and yummy pastries made it a great experience. Thank you !

text.text:
This shop was amazing. I had the hazelnut, chocolate puff pastry and the sesame walnut puff pastry and it was airy, delicious, and refreshing. I also got the bourbon brûlée iced latte and it was the perfect fall tasting drink.

As for the service, I would like to thank the wonderful employee that has short hair. I cannot have gelatin as I am Muslim and she kindly informed me that all the cute cakes have gelatin. This gesture was really sweet to me and because of it I will be recommending this spot to all my friends that come visit. The hospitality really made a difference. This on top of the great drinks and yummy pastries made it a great experience. Thank you !

originalText.text: Cute little bakery/simple cafe type of place, a stone's throw away from Times Square and the rest which explains the prices...but to be fair, at least their offerings are worth it. Came on a calm Friday lunchtime, with a few people sitting in though I ordered for takeaway. The pastries are obviously *adorable*, it makes it very hard to choose. I settled on the little pig that was filled with an incredibly light mousse inside. Also got two cream puffs - the earl grey and the taro. I was surprised to find the earl grey a bit too...mild, almost for my liking - but certainly nothing wrong with it. The taro cream puff was absolutely my overall favourite - totally stuffed with the lilac cream, but still nicely light and most importantly, not too sweet. Only sad that I didn't have a chance to try any of their drinks, the menu looked great!
